trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when a name conflict occurs while generating a strongly typed <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class is not intended for use as a stand-alone component, but as a class from which other classes derive standard functionality.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class is not intended for use as a stand-alone component, but as a class from which other classes derive standard functionality.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class is not intended for use as a stand-alone component, but as a class from which other classes derive standard functionality.
<xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> object containing a dynamic list of exceptions.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException"></xref> class with the specified string.
The <xref:System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class is not intended for use as a stand-alone component, but as a class from which other classes derive standard functionality.
The string to display when the exception is thrown.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException"></xref> class using the specified serialization information and streaming context.
The <xref:System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class is not intended for use as a stand-alone component, but as a class from which other classes derive standard functionality.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> structure.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException"></xref> class with the specified string and inner exception.
The <xref:System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class is not intended for use as a stand-alone component, but as a class from which other classes derive standard functionality.
The string to display when the exception is thrown.
A reference to an inner exception.
Gets a dynamic list of generated errors.
The <xref:System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class is not intended for use as a stand-alone component, but as a class from which other classes derive standard functionality.
<xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> object.
Implements the `ISerializable` interface and returns the data needed to serialize the <xref href="System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Data.TypedDataSetGeneratorException> class is not intended for use as a stand-alone component, but as a class from which other classes derive standard functionality.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> structure.
